Brock looks closely at the drawing, which is in excellent edges have partially disintegrated. The woman is beautifu rendered. In her late teens or early twenties, she is nud with a kind of casual modesty. She is on an Empire divan, light that seems to radiate outward from her eyes. Scrawl right corner is the date: April 14 1912. And the initials The girl is not entirely nude. At her throat is a diamond large stone hanging in the center. Treasure hunter Brock Lovett is best known for finding Sp sunken galleons in the Caribbean. Now he is using deep su technology to work two and a half miles down at another f Titanic. He is with us live via satellite from a Russian the middle of the Atlantic... hello Brock?
Yes, hi, Tracy. You know, Titanic is not just A shipwrick shipwreck. It's the Mount Everest of shipwrecks.

I don't know about you, but I intend to write a strongly the White Star Line about all this. She laughs weakly, but it sounds like a gasp of fear. Ros in the dim light.
I love you Jack. He takes her hand.
No... don't say your good-byes, Rose. Don't you give up.
I'm so cold.
You're going to get out of this... you're going to go on to make babies and watch them grow and you're going to di warm in your bed. Not here. Not this night. Do you unders
I can't feel my body.
Rose, listen to me. Listen. Winning that ticket was the b ever happened to me. Jack is having trouble getting the breath to speak.
It brought me to you. And I'm thankful, Rose. I'm thankfu His voice is trembling with the cold which is working tis But his eyes are unwavering.
You must do me this honor... promise me you will survive. never give up... no matter what happens... no matter how promise me now, and never let go of that promise.
I promise.
Never let go.
I promise. I will never let go, Jack. I'll never let go. She grips his hand and they lie with their heads together except for the lapping of the water.

As the women step gingerly across the other boats, Lowe s figure in too much of a hurry. He rips the shawl off, and staring into the face of a man. Right, man the oars.
